Definition.WordDefinition:
Topical \Top"ic*al\, a. [Cf. F. topique, LL. topicus, Gr. ?. See {Topic}, n.] 1. Of or pertaining to a place; limited; logical application; as, a topical remedy; a topical claim or privilege. [1913 Webster]
2. (Rhet. & logic) Pertaining to, or consisting of, a topic or topics; according to topics. [1913 Webster]
3. Resembling a topic, or general maxim; hence, not demonstrative, but merely probable, as an argument. [1913 Webster]
Evidences of fact can be no more than topical and probable. --Sir M. Hale. [1913 Webster]

topical adj 1: pertaining to the surface of a body part; "a drug for topical (or local) application"; "a topical anesthesia" 2: of or relating to or arranged by topics; "a detailed record on both a chronological and a topical basis" 3: of interest at the present time; "a topical reference"; "a topical and timely study of civil liberty"
